author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...KIKO WEAKENS SLIGHTLY BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 2 HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...
summary: ...KIKO WEAKENS SLIGHTLY BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 2 HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... As of 11:00 PM HST Sun Sep 07 the center of Kiko was located near 19.6, -147.6 with movement NW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 982 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 100 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...KIKO WEAKENS SLIGHTLY BUT REMAINS A CATEGORY 2 HURRICANE... ...EXPECTED TO PASS NORTH OF THE HAWAIIAN ISLANDS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... As of 11:00 PM HST Sun Sep 07 the center of Kiko was located near 19.6, -147.6 with movement NW at 14 mph. The minimum central pressure was 982 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 100 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Kiko (CP4/EP112025)
